channel.title: I downloaded a client for a server and get "'Java' is not recognized..." Error
channel.description:
I just need to know what the Path and CLASSPATH variable values are supposed to be set to in order to run a client to somone elses server.
Whatever the default is, or your path and classpath should work.
thx, Fishy

item.title: I downloaded a client for a server and get "'Java' is not recognized..." Error
item.dc:creator: @cdoggy cdoggy
item.description:
@cdoggy wrote:

If you use a compiler like that you have to make sure that java is set up as a system variable.

Read full topic

item.title: I downloaded a client for a server and get "'Java' is not recognized..." Error
item.dc:creator: @fuckedup111 fuckedup111
item.description:
@fuckedup111 wrote:

Well, how about a compiler like this :

@echo off cd src javac -d ../bin *.java pause
I see this many times to.
They work for me, but many people tell me that it doesn’t…

Read full topic
item.source: I downloaded a client for a server and get "'Java' is not recognized..." Error

item.title: I downloaded a client for a server and get "'Java' is not recognized..." Error
item.dc:creator: @cdoggy cdoggy
item.description:
@cdoggy wrote:

Yep, just as he said, find your java folder (Maker sure you have JDK installed), usually in your program files, go into the folder and then into the bin folder, copy the directory, something like: C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_17\bin, add javac.exe to the end to get something like: C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_17\bin\javac.exe, then paste that into your compiler. If you have a more complicated compiler try posting it up here.

Read full topic
item.source: I downloaded a client for a server and get "'Java' is not recognized..." Error

item.title: I downloaded a client for a server and get "'Java' is not recognized..." Error
item.dc:creator: @wohuynia wohuynia
item.description:
@wohuynia wrote:

right click on your compiler and press edit

the edit the "c:… part,that is path that isn’t recognizing the java, you have to set it exact path to your java.

@echo off
@title
echo Compiling… Please wait.
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_17\bin\javac.exe” ./files/*.java
pause

set "C:…\javac.exe to your java\bin\javac.exe path.

Read full topic
